#Text=Federer wins fifth Wimbledon title
#Text=Monday , July 9 , 2007
#Text=World number one in tennis Roger Federer has defeated Spaniard Rafael Nadal to win his fifth consecutive Wimbledon mens single title .
#Text=The 25-year-old Swiss maestro overcame the second-seeded Nadal in five sets , 7-6 , 4-6 , 7-6 , 2-6 , 6-2 .
#Text=The final took 3 hours and 45 minutes to complete .
#Text=Federer , who lost to Nadal in the 2007 French Open final less than a month ago , equalled Swede Bjorn Borg ' s record of five straight Wimbledon titles .
#Text=Borg was men singles champions at the All England Club between 1976 and 1980 .
#Text=Borg attended the match and met with Federer afterwards to offer his congratulations .
#Text=The match was very evenly contested throughout all five sets .
#Text=Federer won the first set in a tiebreak , 9-7 , which featured a series of uncharacteristic errors from both players .
#Text=Both players had broken each other early in the first set .
#Text=Federer was in trouble on serve twice in the second set .
#Text=He managed to recover from 15-40 down in the sixth game with three successive aces - Federer ended up serving 24 aces in the match to Nadal 's one .
#Text=However , he could n't repeat the effort in the tenth game , and Nadal broke to close the set out 6-4 .
#Text=The third set went on serve for all twelve games , with no breaks leaving the score at 6-all .
#Text=Federer won the tiebreak 7-3 .
#Text=The fourth set was entirely different again .
#Text=Nadal charged out to a 4-0 lead , aided by the assistance of the Hawkeye appeals system .

#Text=Federer , who has been an outspoken critic of the technology , snapped at the end of the third game after a Nadal ball was called ' out ' but overturned after Hawkeye revealed that 2 mm of the ball had touched the back of the line .
#Text=" How in the world was that ball in ? ...
